remarks: We can define an acceptable function on any ordinal. As with many of the transfinite recursion theorems, we have a hypothesis that states that ` F ` is a function and that it is defined for all ordinals.  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 4-Mar-2019.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 24-May-2019.)
statement:
tfrlemisucfn.1 $e |- A = { f | E. x e. On ( f Fn x /\ A. y e. x ( f ` y ) = ( F ` ( f |` y ) ) ) } $.
tfrlemisucfn.2 $e |- ( ph -> A. x ( Fun F /\ ( F ` x ) e. _V ) ) $.
tfrlemi1 $p |- ( ( ph /\ C e. On ) -> E. g ( g Fn C /\ A. u e. C ( g ` u ) = ( F ` ( g |` u ) ) ) ) $.
$d A f g u x y $.
$d C g u $.
$d F f g u x y $.
$d f ph y $.
